#summary The address height attribute is a deprecated method of specifying the height of the element's bounding box.
#labels about-html,is-html-attribute

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [HTMLReference HTML Reference] > [HTMLElements Elements] > [AddressElement <address> element] > *height attribute*

== Usage ==

{{{
<address height=50>Copyright &copy; 2007 John Doe</address>
}}}

== Values ==

The `height` attribute specifies the height in pixels, and as such it must be a positive integer, or 0.  Unlike heights in CSS, this attribute must NOT include the "px" unit of measure.  The `height` attribute is always understood in pixels.

== Elements ==

You can use the `height` attribute on the following elements:

  * [AddressElement <address>]
  * [AppletElement <applet>]
  * [BlockquoteElement <blockquote>]
  * [CaptionElement <caption>]
  * [CanvasElement <canvas>]
  * [CenterElement <center>]
  * [DdElement <dd>]
  * [DirElement <dir>]
  * [DivElement <div>]
  * [DlElement <dl>]
  * [DtElement <dt>]
  * [EmbedElement <embed>]
  * [FieldsetElement <fieldset>]
  * [FormElement <form>]
  * [FrameElement <frame>]
  * [IframeElement <iframe>]
  * [IlayerElement <ilayer>]
  * [ImgElement <img>]
  * [InputElement <input>]
  * [IsindexElement <isindex>]
  * [LayerElement <layer>]
  * [LiElement <li>]
  * [ListingElement <listing>]
  * [MarqueeElement <marquee>]
  * [MenuElement <menu>]
  * [ObjectElement <object>]
  * [OlElement <ol>]
  * [PElement <p>]
  * [SpacerElement <spacer>]
  * [TableElement <table>]
  * [TdElement <td>]
  * [ThElement <th>]
  * [TextareaElement <textarea>]
  * [TrElement <tr>]
  * [UlElement <ul>]
